message: Were we meeting today?
I just assumed we were meeting every other day lol
me too.  I was hoping @MuraliRaju had a chance to give me feedback on the testing suites.
we can switch it up this time and meet tomorrow with a formal notice i guess so everyone can join
I don't have too much to report yet myself
I think meeting tomorrow would be a good idea ;-)
Me too.  I still need to work on updating that software architecture
Ya i am also working on the traceability and don't have anything to show yet :)
I found this which looks more promising.  http://www.codingthearchitecture.com/pages/book/software-architecture-document-guidelines.html
I saw that one too the other night it did look good (I was tempted to buy the book right then and there but decided to hold off a bit, but I think it would be an excellent resource)
So tomorrow then? That'll give me some more time to work on some experiments tonight with the SQLite stuff
Sounds good to me, see you guys then
Good luck! Till then :D
@TonyPotter  I did post comment about the test suite last week.  Let me find it.
I had seen you mentioned it didn't match exactly what you had written
I thought you had mentioned we were going to go through them and revise them
If you want i can do that tonight/tomorrow and compare notes.
Yes.  I thought the test case review should be combined with our plan for the final product.  Test Case -> Design vs Requirements->Design->Test Case.
Other wise we will be doing a lot of coding just to pass the test cases.
ok. I'll continue to work on them and we'll talk tomorro wthen?
I think we should do this as a team - based on time availability for coding.
Before you spend any more time on test cases we should freeze design/requirements.
I had written those based on what I thought were expected behaviors.
so for requirements we're freezing?
are we allowing editing of VIP account?
I meant UI requirements - details we did not get into.
ah.
Lets walk through the test cases also tomorrow. That way we can freeze everything at once.
ok. sounds good.
Any ideas on the code and class design.  Use as is or change some classes?
I took some short cuts because it was proto.
It depends how we can integrate MySQL.  Do we want db to take care of data structures or do we want to code data structures?
And I was running out of time.
I was thinking the former,
for persistance is there any other choice.
The database class was for temporary use.
More along the lines, do we want to create objects and load from DB into objects or directly call data from db fields?
I prefer load into objects - we can then use the db class.
Do we need to create a customer class, load all the fields, and edit as needed, then update all fields in DB or do we want to have direct access to db fields?
It's an encapsulation issue, s'why I'm asking
Customer class.
So we'll need to code tohse classes up - customer, purchase, and db hooks to interact with them.
I can work on those classes, Omar mentioned he was looking up ways to connect to db
Ok as before I dont mind you taking the lead on alpha and beta and I will assist.
ok.
I'll get some rough classes up tomorrow then.
tomorrow we can talk about db hooks and freezing
OK tomorrow the. Gnite.

@MuraliRaju  I pushed Customer.java to represent customer, Item.java as an interface implemented by Coffee.java and Dessert.java, and Purchase.java to represent purchases.  I put in some empty methods to allow data to be loaded or saved to/from db.  Let me know ifyou have any questions, otherwise I'll be back around eight.
